org.mt4j.input.inputData
Class MTInputEvent

java.lang.Object
  org.mt4j.input.MTEvent
      org.mt4j.input.inputData.MTInputEvent
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractCursorInputEvt, MTGestureEvent
public class MTInputEvent
extends MTEvent

The Class MTInputEvent. The base class for all input events.

Author:
Christopher Ruff

Method Detail

getTargetComponent

public IMTComponent3D getTargetComponent()
Deprecated. use getTarget() instead

Gets the target of this input event.
NOTE: Not every event has a target component! To check this we can call event.hasTarget().

Returns:
the target component
See Also:
getTarget()

getTarget

public IMTComponent3D getTarget()
Gets the target of this input event.
NOTE: Not every event has a target component! To check this we can call event.hasTarget().

Returns:
the target component

setTarget

public void setTarget(IMTComponent3D targetComponent)
Sets the target component of this input event.
NOTE: This is supposed to be called internally by MT4j and not by users.

Parameters:
targetComponent - the new target component

hasTarget

public boolean hasTarget()
Checks if this input event has a target component.

Returns:
true, if successful

onFired

public void onFired()
This method is invoked right before the event is fired. This can be used to do event specific actions if needed before firing.
NOTE: this is called internally and should not be called by users!

setEventPhase

public void setEventPhase(short phase)
The setEventPhase method is used by the DOM implementation to change the value of a eventPhase attribute on the Event interface.

Parameters:
phase - Specifies the eventPhase attribute on the Event interface.

getEventPhase

public short getEventPhase()

stopPropagation

public void stopPropagation()

public boolean isPropagationStopped()

public boolean getBubbles()

setCurrentTarget

public void setCurrentTarget(IMTComponent3D target)
The setCurrentTarget method is used by the DOM implementation to change the value of a currentTarget attribute on the Event interface.

Parameters:
target - Specifies the currentTarget attribute on the Event interface.
